ca.mcgill.ecse211.main_package

Class LightPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.main_package.LightPoller

  • public class LightPoller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the data collected by the light sensor used for localization and odometry correction. It is meant to be used when the robot has to detect black lines on a grid. It has methods detecting rising and falling changes in the data from the light sensor which in turn, mean that a line has been found.
    Author:
    Tritin

      This is the class constructor which is comprised of the sample from the light sensor and its value.

        public LightPoller(SampleProvider lt,

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public void getValue()

      • lessThan

        public boolean lessThan(int threshold)
        Boolean method to determine if a light value is lower than the threshold set. The threshold is a value where a black object would return a sample with lower value all the time.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Threshold value for black line
        Returns:
        True is lower, False otherwise

      • falling

        public boolean falling(int threshold)
        Boolean method to determine if the data value is reducing. (between tile and line) This method takes the first sample as the previous one and takes the second sample as the current one. Then, it takes the difference between the previous and current sample and finds if there is a falling edge there. The Current value then becomes the previous one for next time.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Delta value accepted
        Returns:
        True if falling edge is found, false otherwise

      • rising

        public boolean rising(int threshold)
        Boolean method to determine if the data value is rising. (between end of line and next tile) This method takes the first sample as the previous one and takes the second sample as the current one. Then, it takes the difference between the previous and current sample and finds if there is a rising edge there. The Current value then becomes the previous one for next time.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Delta value accepted
        Returns:
        True if rising edge is found, false otherwise
